title: The Monochromatic
description: This Monochromatic series is an effort to retain the internal beauty and magnanimity of usual objects and settings in the simplicity and subtle charm of colors.
The pictures dwell mostly on neutral colors, mainly on earth colors and soft contrasting shades, so the tones would be calm and filled with silence and introspection.
For instance, the photo of the peanuts and sardines is one that conveys a sense of frozen domestic life, in which food and routine loom larger, almost zen-like, when cast in monochromatic terms.

Similarly, the photo of the mirror, with its expanding grid of mirrors, is one that carries the sense of infinite reflection, symbolic of the manner in which even such common, everyday items can cause one to ponder ideas regarding perception and identity.

By reducing the color to one universal palette, these photos invite the audience to focus    more on form, texture, and shape, allowing them to become familiar with the objects' position in our world and the emotions behind them that they might trigger.

title: Spot Community News
description: In this community news series, the unguarded moments in these photos illustrate the day-to-day action and mood of a busy service setting.
The first image is of a staff member wrapping up warm, just-baked cookies, demonstrating the care and devotion that goes into delivering a reassuring, familiar product.

The second image relocates to a kitchen environment where some of the staff are working with fresh fruits and vegetables, showing the extra effort expended behind preparing quality food for the masses.
The third image shows the busiest life within a fast-food store, recognizing the coordination and cooperation required in passing food across to consumers as quickly as possible.

Collectively, these images provide a glimpse into the day-in-the-life of the men and women who serve and work for and in our communities, and show the behind-the-scenes effort that keeps both the local businesses and the people who come to visit them alive.

That daylight exists and that these are candid shots gives the viewer the permission to celebrate the mundane, and often uncelebrated, work of these workers and raises the humdrum to stories of duty and service.

title: Sports Photography
description: In this series, the athlete is captured in moments that show the energy and focus that come with playing basketball.
The first shot shows them holding the ball up high, ready to take a shot—a perfect moment of concentration and confidence.
Then I see the player in motion, half-leap to the basket, with everything around them blurring to emphasize the speed and tension of the game.
I get a close-up of their hands on the ball and can see how close the game is, how the player is totally in the moment.

Throughout the series, the player is depicted in various poses, ranging from jumping up from the ground to making quick movements on the court, demonstrating the agility, speed, and strength needed to play.
The shots capture the essence of basketball—the action, the heat, and the capability of playing at this level.

title: Environmental Portrait
description: In the photographs, we have a series of domestic family moments that are being captured in real, spontaneous settings.

The first photograph takes a tender moment where an adult is lifting up a child, and one can see the tenderness and intimacy of their engagement. The natural light pouring through the windows adds a sense of intimacy and calmness to the ambiance.
In the second image, the child sits in a calm, contemplative position, gazing out of the window, as the light from behind the blinds brings attention to the peaceful, quiet environment.

The third photo shows the start of the day, two children in bed, a moment of tranquility before the day's activities start, their bodies covered under warm blankets, with the gentle sunlight filtering through the curtains.

The final photo shows the child performing a daily activity, cooking in the kitchen—a moment of maturity and independence. The cluttered but comfortable kitchen scene encapsulates the security of home and the ease of habit, with golden, warm light a sense of safety and protection.
They collectively represent a narrative of family life—moments of tendermess, playfulness, quiet viewing, and growing independence—enveloped in the comforting, inviting presence of home.

title: Photo Essay
description: For my final project, I wanted to explore how nature and personal healing interact.
I had played with how the subtle unfolding of spring can mirror the emotional and intellectual struggles many experience, and how nature can bring a sense of calm and renewal.

The project starts with images that show the weight of mental illness, like pills spilling out of a bottle into a hand, and words 'I'm dying' written on someone's face. These images show the inner struggle and set the stage for what is to follow.
As the project goes on, the tone shifts to a more positive one to show the healing potential of nature.
In one image, a person walks barefoot in a stream, and in another, flowers are being shoved into their hair. These are the scenes of the peace that comes with embracing the rhythms of nature.
The sun passing through leaves and the easy movement of the subject give a feeling of letting go and finding peace.
The further we go in the essay, the more the topic is seen reclining in nature, finally relaxed among the lush greens of the forest.
The final photographs in the essay capture the subject lying on the forest floor, peaceful and smiling, summarizing the time of healing and peace after a moment of conflict.
The essay ends with the subject standing next to a tree, representing the unity and harmony seen between trees.
Through showing these photographs, I aimed to prove that healing is not simple, but in nature, there is a place to do things slowly, think, and feel at ease.
